ACT
13
If one parent died without offspring
If one of the testator's parents died before the testator who did not leave a spouse and did not leave any descendants, the part of the estate that would have belonged to him if he had survived the testator is inherited by the other parent, and if the latter also died before the testator who did not leave a spouse, his descendants they inherit what would belong to one and the other parent, as determined in Article 12 of this Act.
